intro: Eriogonum effusum subsp. helichrysoides, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its dense clusters of yellow to golden-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and gravelly soils. It has small, narrow leaves and a low-growing, mat-like structure. This subspecies is part of the buckwheat family (Polygonaceae) and is known for its ecological importance to pollinators.
